lumpyrem.lr2series module¶

class lumpyrem.lr2series.TimeSeries(ts_file, lr_models, ts_names, lumprem_ouput_cols, div_delta_t=True, workspace=False)¶

Bases: object

A class used to link a MODFLOW6 timeseries file to LUMPREM model outputs.

ts_file¶

filename and path of MODFLOW6 timeseries file to write.

Type

str

lr_models¶

list of lumpyrem Model objects.

Type

list

ts_names¶

list of names for timeseries to include in the MODFLOW6 timeseries file.

Type

list of str

lumprem_ouput_cols¶

list of LUMPREM output columns to import as timeseries. This list must match ts_names length and order.

Type

list of str

div_delta_t¶

True (Default) if LR2SERIES div_delta_t. False if LR2SERIES no_div_delta_t .

Type

bool

workspace¶

Path to workspace folder. Default is current working directory.

Type

path

write_ts()¶

Writes the MODFLOW6 timeseries file.

lumpyrem.lumprem module¶

class lumpyrem.lumprem.Model(model_name, rainfile='rain.dat', epotfile='epot.dat', vegfile='veg.in', irrigfile='irrig.in', maxvol=0.5, irrigvolfrac=0.5, rdelay=5, mdelay=1, ks=0.1, M=0.5, L=0.5, mflowmax=0.1, offset=0.0, factor1=1.0, factor2=1.0, power=0.0, vol=False, silofile=False, workspace=False)¶

Bases: object

A class used to represent a lumprem.in file. It facilitates the generating LUMPREM models and handling outputs. Default values are provded for all parameters however the user is advised to update those pertinnent to their case.

model_name¶

name for LUMPREM model. Must be 3 characters or less.

Type

str

rainfile¶

name of rain file (default 'ran.dat').

Type

str or tuple, optional

epotfile¶

name of evaporation file (default 'epot.dat').

vegfile¶

name of vegfile file or tuple with crop factor and gamma (default 'veg.in').

Type

str or tuple, optional

irrigfile¶

name of irrigation file or tuple with irrigation code and groundwater extraction fraction (default 'irrig.in').

Type

str or tuple, optional

maxvol¶

volume of soil moisture (default 0.5)

Type

float, optional

vol¶

volume at beggining of model run (default maxvol/2)

Type

float, optional

irrigvolfrac¶

fraction of soil moisture irrigation must maintain, between 0.0 and 1.0. (default 0.5)

Type

float, optional

rdelay¶

delay in days between water draining from soil moisture and being assigned to grounwater recharge (default 5)

Type

int, optional

mdelay¶

delay in days between water draining from soil moisture and being assigned to macropore grounwater recharge (default 1)

Type

int, optional

ks¶

saturated hydraulic conductivity (default 0.1)

Type

float,optional

L¶

pore connectivity parameter (default 0.5)

Type

float, optional

M¶

parameter determining the shape of drainage rate vs stored water relationship (default 0.5)

Type

float, optional

mflowmax¶

maximum macropore recharegg allowed per day (default 0.1)

Type

float, optional

offset¶

an offset, used to adjust volume to elevation (default 0.0)

Type

float, optional

factor 1

factor1 in LUMPREM, used to adjust volume to elevation (default 1.0)

Type

float, optional

factor 2

factor2 in LUMPREM, used to adjust volume to elevation (default 1.0)

Type

float, optional

power¶

fapower in LUMPREM, used to adjust volume to elevation (default 1.0)

Type

float, optional

silofile¶

This is to facilitate interaction with the LUMPREP simulation class (default False).

Type

bool, optional

workspace¶

path to workspace folder. Default is current working directory

Type

path

get_results()¶

Reads the results from the LUMPREM model and returns a Dataframe with parameters and results.

Returns

final -- Pandas dataframe of model results and parameters.

Return type

DataFrame

run_model()¶

Runs the LUMPREM on model.

write_irigfile(numdays, irrig_start, fracyear=0.3, irrigfile='irrig.in', irrig_end=None, date_start='01/01/1900')¶

Writes an irrigation input file to be used by LUMPREM.

Parameters

  • numdays (int) -- total number of days for the simulation

  • irrig_start (str, int) -- first date or day on which irrigation starts. Can be positive number of days or str in 'dd/mm/yyyy' format. If str, then it must be later than start_date. If date str is used then start_date must be set.

  • fracyear (float, optional) -- fraction of the year during which irrigation occurs. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0 (default 0.3)

  • irrig_end (str, optional) -- optionally the first date on which irrigation ends can be provided instead of fracyear. Must be str in forrmat 'dd/mm/yyyy'(default None). Requires start_date and irrig_start in str date format as well.

  • date_start (str, optional) -- date on which simulation starts (default '01/01/1900'). This aids in accoutning for month lengths and leap years.

  • irrigfile (str, optional) -- name of irrigation file to write (default 'irrig.in')

write_model(file=False, numdays=100, noutdays=None, nstep=1, mxiter=100, tol=1e-05, rbuf=[0.0], mbuf=[0.0])¶

Writes the LUMPREM model input files. Default values are provded for all parameters however the user is advised to update those pertinnent to their case.

Parameters

  • file (str, optional) -- file name to write (default is the model_name with the sufix 'lr_' and file extension '.in'. For example: 'lr_abc.in')

  • numdays (int, optional) -- number of days of the model run (default 100)

  • noutdays (int, optional) -- number of days for which output is desired (default None, results in all days being recoreded)

  • nstep (int, optonal) -- number of steps into which each day is divided for iterative soil moisture computation (default 1)

  • mxiter (int, optional) -- max iterations per step 9default 100)

  • tol (float, optional) -- convergence tolerance

  • rbuf (list, optional) -- the recharge delay buffer for intial conditions. List of volumes assumed to have left soil moisture on previous days. First element left soil moisture on previous day. Second element two days previously, etc.

  • mbuf (list, optional) -- the macropore delay bufferfor intial conditions. Same setup as rbuf.

lumpyrem.lumprep module¶

class lumpyrem.lumprep.Simulation(model_list, silofile, start_date, end_date, steps_per_day=1, nday_out='monthly', batch_file='run.bat', pest_control_file='temp.pst')¶

Bases: object

A class used to represent a lumprep.in file. It facilitates the generating coherent LUMPREM models and using a silofile as input for climate data.

model_list¶

list of lumprem Model objects

Type

list

silofile¶

tuple with (silo file name, column name). This is the silofile to read, and the column to be used for evapotranspiration data.For example: ('silofile.txt','evap')

Type

tuple

start_date¶

start date of the simulation. Must be in format dd/mm/yyyy.

Type

str

end_date¶

end date of the simulation. Must be in format dd/mm/yyyy.

Type

str

steps_per_day¶

LUMPREP variable steps_per_day and nstep control variable in LUMPREM (default 1)

Type

int, optional

nday_out¶

must be either a positive int or the str 'monthly'. Defines the time interval in days at which LUMPREM records results.

Type

int, str, optional

batch_file¶

name of the batch file to be generated.(default 'run.bat')

Type

str, optional

pest_control_file¶

name of the pest control file to be generated.(default 'temp.pst')

Type

str, optional

get_results()¶

Reads the results from all LUMPREM models in the Simulation object and returns a Dataframe with parameters and results.

Returns

final -- Pandas dataframe of all model results and parameters from the Simulation object.

Return type

DataFrame

run_simulation()¶

Runs LUMPREM on models created using LUMPREP in the Simulation object.

write_simulation(infile='lumprep.in')¶

Writes the LUMPREP input file from the Simulation object. :param infile: filename for the LUMPREP input file (default 'lumprep.in') :type infile: str

lumpyrem.run module¶

lumpyrem.run.run_process(process, path=False, commands=[], print_output=True)¶

This calls a process and then executes a list of commands.

Parameters

  • process (str) -- The name of the process to execute.

  • path (str, optional) -- path in which to execute commands. False (default) result sin commans being executed in current working directory.

  • commands (list of str) -- sequence of commands to pass to the process.

  • print_output (bool, optional) -- True, process output is printed. False, it is not.
